titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ruth M. Harris Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Alice Yafeh and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:10

did.abstract: These papers document the work of various student Christian movements from the 1950s through the 1990s and the activities of the World Student Christian Federation Trustees, particularly in preparation for the WSCF Centennial and the Women's History Project. Ruth M. Harris was a leader in United Methodist and ecumenical student Christian work.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ruth M. Harris Papers (RG 171), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

chronitem.event: B.A.. Morningside College, Sioux City, IA
Field program director for Student Volunteer Movement for Foreign Missions
United Methodist Board of Global Ministries, Women's Division, student work

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers have been retained in the order in which they were received from Ms. Harris. The material in Series I documents the work of various student Christian organizations in the U.S. from the 1950s through the 1990s. Series II documents Harris' s work with the World Student Christian Federation Trustees and Senior Friends. This series includes minutes of the Trustees from 1989 to 1999 and documentation of the Trustees' Centennial Program. Series III provides a chronological sequence of materials documenting interregional and regional activities of the the WSCF. Of particular interest is documentation of the WSCF Women's Commission and Women's History Project.

A number of printed publications received with the Harris Papers have been integrated with the Divinity Library's cataloged collections of books and periodicals, or into archival record groups related to the World Student Christian Federation (Record Group No. 46) or World Council of Churches (Record Group No. 162.) Cataloged publications include the following:

list.item: Presence (WSCF magazine for African Christian students), 1969-1970

scopecontent.p: The Ruth M. Harris Papers complement a number of other personal papers and archival collections at the Yale Divinity School Library, including the Margaret Flory Papers and the Archives of the WSCF, Student Christian Movement of New England, and University Christian Movement.

list.item: I. Student Christian Movements in the United States
II. World Student Christian Federation Trustees
III. World Student Christian Federation Activities
